name: places/ChIJ83Ie2iBZwokRSHxTfX9JjmM
formattedAddress: 381 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 381 Bleecker St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: I was in the area and stopped by to get some gift ideas. The products appear of very high quality from an Italian manufacturer.  Apparently 50+ years  in business.. The staff was very nice and accommodating, was not pushy at all... and just allowed me to look at what I wanted to, to collect ideas.... I would definitely go back... The prices seem current... I would not consider them cheap but you would not expect for something of very high quality... Really nice selection for a pretty cozy store.

text.text: I was in the area and stopped by to get some gift ideas. The products appear of very high quality from an Italian manufacturer.  Apparently 50+ years  in business.. The staff was very nice and accommodating, was not pushy at all... and just allowed me to look at what I wanted to, to collect ideas.... I would definitely go back... The prices seem current... I would not consider them cheap but you would not expect for something of very high quality... Really nice selection for a pretty cozy store.

originalText.text: I discovered this store / brand while on a trip to Milan a few months ago. When I found out there was one in NYC, I had to visit! This is such a hidden gem, the quality is outstanding. I purchased a beautiful wallet that I get asked about all the time. The wallet is made of only leather and the brass for the buttons, no filler at all. Will be back!

text.text: I discovered this store / brand while on a trip to Milan a few months ago. When I found out there was one in NYC, I had to visit! This is such a hidden gem, the quality is outstanding. I purchased a beautiful wallet that I get asked about all the time. The wallet is made of only leather and the brass for the buttons, no filler at all. Will be back!

originalText.text: The staff here are always so incredibly kind and knowledgeable. High quality products for a good price. I own multiple pieces and they have aged beautifully

text.text: The staff here are always so incredibly kind and knowledgeable. High quality products for a good price. I own multiple pieces and they have aged beautifully

originalText.text:
It has passed some time of what happened in this establishment. I've been undecided whether to comment or not, but I think it's always better not to stay silent.

A few months ago (September 10 of last year if I remember correctly), I was in NYC. I had gone with my husband to some sessions at the UN on Human Rights and family issues. As I dealt with these issues, as well as gender and equality issues, I couldn't feel nothing for what happened.

What I will comment for many will be something insignificant. For others, it may take some discomfort and it would be logical when touching on a sensitive subject such as respect and non-discrimination.

Walking the day before our departure in Bleecker and discussing with my husband about the issues discussed there, we passed this store. It caught my attention to go. We were on the other side of the street and I told my partner: come with me. We cross the street. As we crossed, a woman inside the store was walking towards the door (I thought she would kindly come to receive us) and when my husband and I were in front of the door, we saw and heard how the woman had put the lock/key on the door and she crossed her arms. Inside, another young man was sitting and saw the situation and just stared at it without doing anything. I was shocked.

My husband and I had a few seconds of silence. We decided to go. After the awkward moment, we did not know whether to notify our relatives and known institutions about the treatment in this store. We let it go temporarily. For now, this is the message I would like to leave to anyone who reads it:

The place is externally good and the products look of good quality. It is the people who serve who sadly did not have human qualities. People who stand out to the establishment not for its customer service, but for its selectivity in the clientele.

Being honest, it is a store that does not make you want to return like others where the attention, service and treatment are splendid. What makes a place of quality is that, not prices, nationality or skin color.

Now, why do I telling this now? It seems to me that it is never too late to point out and contribute something. I dedicate myself to human rights issues. I have been a civil servant in my country and I always put the person at the center. I can deal with this, but there are a lot of people out there who can't, it affects you and can cause you serious mental health injuries when it's not your fault. When the complexes are one of those who exercise this type of psychological violence through discrimination. As what I am and what I have been trained in, I feel obliged to speak about it and put on the table absurd events that continue to happen day by day and without any conscience.

I don't expect any apology. Not a good deal either because I'm not going back (at least nota for buy). I just hope that no one else from now on has a hard time at this establishment, and that this establishment make people proud and not disappointed in purchasing their products. That is what will define them at the end of everything. Let the client choose you and not you the client.

With all due respect and with the aim of contributing to your improvement.

originalText.text: Beautiful small artisan Italian leather goods store, warm and knowledgeable staff and very high quality craftsmanship. Highly recommend as investment pieces

text.text: Beautiful small artisan Italian leather goods store, warm and knowledgeable staff and very high quality craftsmanship. Highly recommend as investment pieces
